parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From zelos; to have warmth of feeling for or against.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To shut out, exclude, separate. From ek and kleio; to shut out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From zelos; to have warmth of feeling for or against.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
